content: While faith can involve a sense of uncertainty or not knowing, it is not necessarily a binary between knowledge and ignorance. Rather, faith often involves trust and belief in something beyond what can be known or proven through empirical means. It can involve a deep sense of conviction and commitment to a particular belief or worldview, even in the absence of concrete evidence. While the concept of a "leap of faith" suggests a sudden or dramatic act, faith can also develop gradually over time through experiences, personal reflection, and community support.
